text: In macroeconomics, Aggregate Demand (AD) or Domestic Final Demand (DFD) is the total demand for final goods and services in an economy at a time. This is the demand for the gross domestic product of a country. It shows the amount of goods and services that will be bought at all possible different prices. ==References== ==Other websites== * Elmer G. Wiens: Classical & Keynesian AD- AS Model - An on-line, interactive model of the Canadian Economy. Category:Macroeconomics
title: Aggregate demand
